title: Baseball Development Systems Coordinator
content:
Job Title: Baseball Development Systems Coordinator Department: Baseball DevelopmentReports To: Director, Baseball DevelopmentLocation: Philadelphia, PA
Position OverviewAs the Baseball Development Systems Coordinator (BDSC) you will work closely with Baseball Development personnel to advance the mission of the department via fortification and improvement of daily production processes and information flow. You will work cross-departmentally within Research and Information (Baseball Development, Research & Development and Integrative Baseball Performance), in addition to interfacing with major league and player development coaches and support staff to optimize processes and report schemes. The position is based in Philadelphia.
Responsibilities

Support ML Strategy and PD analysts via improvement of existing platforms and development of proprietary applications to be used directly by Baseball Development, ML and PD field staff
Strategically facilitate continuity, scalability and trickle-down of key organizational tenets, models and tools from the major leagues through player development
Collaborate cross-departmentally within R&I regarding the design and technical specifications of software and automation solutions for Baseball Development, and work to implement them
Help to augment the technical knowledge of the entire Baseball Development department via training, mentorship and support on the use of all proprietary applications and tools
In tandem with Baseball Operations leadership, plan, prioritize, and implement short, medium and long-term projects that will help advance the mission of Baseball Development and support users across the organization
Regularly interface with relevant product users (ML Strategy and PD analysts, Video and Technology, R&D, ML and PD coaches and support staff) to gain valuable feedback and insight regarding current projects and future organizational needs.
Provide regular reports to the Director, Baseball Development and other Baseball Development and Research & Information personnel in Philadelphia as needed.

Required Qualifications

Possess or are pursuing a BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience
Experience in one or more of the following languages (including but not limited to: Python, R, SQL, JavaScript)
Interest and ability to learn new technologies as needed
Experience working with relational databases.
Experience with app development. Existing platforms are largely written in React, Dash or Shiny.
Proven willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques
Proven leadership and self-direction
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability to work with and protect highly confidential and sensitive information
Ability to communicate effectively, professionally and respectfully with peers, players, coaches, support staff and front office personnel across various departments
Must be able to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays









Preferred Qualifications

Previous experience working in professional and/or college baseball, specifically in Research & Development, Advance Scouting and/or Player Development
Spanish fluency

Interested applicants should submit both their resume and an answer to the following question:
Describe an application you’ve built using one of the programming languages listed in the job description, or an equivalent language, and how that application was leveraged (300 word limit). 
The Phillies are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to growing a workforce diverse in perspective and background. We proudly strive to build a group of employees who represent the fans and communities we currently, and aim to, serve.
